text:
We found a 404, and the response is:

{“status”:“error”,“message”:“Object not found.  objectId are usually numeric.“,”correlationId”:“a7ab9bb1-6576-40e9-9173-9129add8c475”,“context”:{“id”:[“undefined”]},“category”:“OBJECT_NOT_FOUND”}
IS this POST request or GET request?

Hi everyone!
I'm experiencing some difficulties with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/communications|Communication API>, it seems it can't retrieve the whatsapp messages received in an Inbox.
Also I try to search a whatsapp conversation with the ID in the url bar but I cannot find anything.

Anyone have experienced this?
Also it seems that conversation based workflows cannot use whatsapp conversations for testing...
A hint: It seems the *API cannot retrieve the conversation if it's not associated to a contact*
So, after some further investigations, the problem is: how do you retrieve (whatsapp) conversation that are not yet associated to a contact?
Even Engagement V1 API seems to not be able to reach an engagements without contact association
is there a way to search for a list using the API by its filter?

I have reviewed several posts on HubSpot community for an OAuth connection error that is commonly experienced, but they have not helped in resolving our issue. We are integrating one of our applications with our free HubSpot CRM and are running tests to ensure if our users can connect to the HubSpot CRM from our application successfully via OAuth. Here's the issue:

1. Users *who do not have a Super Admin role, get this error* while trying to connect to HubSpot from our application via OAuth: *Couldn't complete the connection You don't have permission to connect this app.*
2. I found this post: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/HubSpot-OAuth-FAQ/m-p/262729> to be insightful and understand that "Whether or not an app can be installed depends on the intersection of the app's required scopes, the account’s included tools, and the authorizing user's roles."
3. We have made sure the non-Super Admin users are assigned the required user permissions that align with our apps required scopes, but we are missing something as we are unable to resolve the above connection error for users who are not Super Admins.
What specific details can I share here for anyone to better assist with this issue?

that is a normal deal get. If you add properties to your request, it will get those additional properties
This is laid out in the api docs, but if you want to do this quickly, you would add ?properties=property_internal_name&properties=another_property

I believe that is how it works
I'm sorry for the runaround. I'm going to DM you.
